meanings.definition: To treat someone as an object rather than as a person.
meanings.sent1: She felt uncomfortable when her boss kept objectifying her during meetings.
meanings.sent2: The artist was objectifying the model by focusing only on her physical features.
meanings.sent3: The robot started objectifying the humans, thinking they were just like any other objects.
meanings.sent4: In his mind, the villain was objectifying the hero, reducing him to a mere obstacle.
meanings.sent5: The movie scene was so vivid, objectifying the character's emotions perfectly.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something into an object.
meanings.sent1: The magician was objectifying the audience's fears into illusions.
meanings.sent2: By painting the landscape, the artist was objectifying nature's beauty.
meanings.sent3: The chef was objectifying the ingredients, turning them into a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The writer was objectifying his thoughts, transforming them into words on paper.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor was objectifying the marble, creating a masterpiece sculpture.

meanings.definition: To view someone solely in terms of their physical attributes.
meanings.sent1: He was objectifying the actress, only focusing on her appearance.
meanings.sent2: The fashion industry often objectifies models, emphasizing their looks over their talents.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about objectifying gym-goers who only cared about their muscles.
meanings.sent4: The advertisement was objectifying beauty standards, promoting unrealistic ideals.
meanings.sent5: The photographer was objectifying the model, capturing her physical features in detail.
